name: fixa
headline: sentry for AI voice agents
description:
Fixa is the Sentry for AI voice agents. Companies like 11x and OfOne use us to run simulated tests, analyze production calls, and fix bugs in their voice agents. 

We were both voice agent developers at PlayHT ‚Äì and, in order to find bugs in our agents, we would spend countless hours manually calling them and listening to conversation recordings. So, we‚Äôve decided to build a platform that does this automatically. 

Fixa shows developers exactly where and how their agents mess up ‚Äì enabling them to pinpoint root causes and fix them faster.

founders.name: Oliver Wendell-Braly, Founder/CEO
founders.description: helping voice agent developers sleep at night

founders.name: Jonathan Liu, Founder/CTO
founders.description:
currently building fixa, the sentry for AI voice agents. helping voice agent companies find and fix bugs in their agents faster. 

previously the co-founder of schej, an open source scheduling website for college students and non-profits with over 30k monthly active users.

## fixa observe
# fix your voice agentsfaster
monitor latency, interruptions, and correctness of your calls to debug and improve your voice agent.
[get started](https://www.fixa.dev/</sign-up>)[interactive demo](https://www.fixa.dev/</demo>)

## features
everything you need for reliable voice agents
comprehensive tools to monitor and improve your ai voice agents
### measure latency
measure how long it takes for your voice agent to respond. track metrics like TTFW and p50/p90/p95 latency.
### flag interruptions
flag instances where your voice agent interrupts the user and talks over them.
### check correctness
set up custom evaluations to check whether your voice agent is saying the right things.
### alerts
set up custom slack alerts to notify you when your voice agent screws up.
## pricing
simple, transparent pricing
choose the plan that best fits your needs
### pay as you go
perfect for teams just getting started
$0.03
/minute
  * no minimum commitment
  * only pay for what you use
  * discord support
  * 10 free calls


[get started](https://www.fixa.dev/</sign-up>)
### enterprise
for organizations with custom needs
contact us
everything in "pay as you go" plus:
  * volume discounts
  * custom integrations
  * priority support
  * SOC 2 & HIPAA compliance


[contact us](https://www.fixa.dev/<https:/cal.com/team/fixa/enterprise-pricing>)

generated_description:
Fixa is a fresh face in the AI voice tech space, founded in 2024 and currently based in San Francisco. Their mission? To be the sentry for AI voice agents, ensuring these agents are as efficient and bug-free as possible. 

The founders, who previously developed voice agents at PlayHT, faced a common problem: diagnosing bugs was a painstaking process, involving countless hours of manual testing. To solve this, they built a platform that automates the testing of voice agents, allowing developers to quickly identify where things go wrong. This backstory not only shows their expertise but fuels their commitment to creating a more effective tool for other developers.

Fixa offers powerful features for developers to monitor their AI voice agents. Their platform tracks latency, interruption rates, and even correctness in responses. They provide custom alerts through Slack to keep users informed when something doesn‚Äôt go as planned. 

Recently, they launched an open-source voice agent testing package, allowing other developers to contribute to and benefit from their work. In terms of pricing, they have a straightforward pay-as-you-go model, which is perfect for teams just starting out, alongside more comprehensive enterprise options for larger organizations.

With a lean team of just two people (growing, no doubt), Fixa is already trusted by companies like 11x and OfOne. They‚Äôve kicked off their journey under the Y Combinator Accelerator‚Äôs F24 batch, gaining invaluable support and exposure in the tech community.

If you‚Äôre involved in AI voice tech, Fixa could be a game-changer. They make it easy to improve voice agents swiftly and effectively. Interested developers can get started with their tools directly on their website at [fixa.dev](https://www.fixa.dev).
